text: Sound plays only for the activator of the trigger.
Assigns q3map_clipmodel to any shaders used by the model. Use ONLY on large models with relatively few triangles in their mesh.
Adds q3map_forcemeta to any shaders used by the model.
Only Blue Team players can activate the trigger.
Only Blue Team members can pick up this rune.
Only Blue team players can see the message.
On pushing, the entity plays a bouncing sound.
Model casts shadows on the map surfaces.
Door crushes player upon closing instead of reversing direction.
The portal camera rotates faster along the roll axis.
Sound plays at full volume throughout the level.
Tags the spawnpoint as initial, players will spawn here when the game starts.
Uses a linear falloff instead of a more realistic invsqrt-based one.
The sound loops and starts turned off in the level.
The sound loops and starts turned on in the level.
Ignores angle attenuation.
Doesn’t count as a dynamic light.
Doesn’t count as a dynamic light, disabling it entirely.
Player is hurt regardless of protection.
Only the player who activated the entity can see the message.
Picks a targetted entity at random and triggers it.
Only Red Team players can activate the trigger.
Only Red Team members can pick up this rune.
Only Red team players can see the message.
Doesn’t play sizzling sound while player is being hurt.
Damage rate changes to once per second instead of server frame.
The portal camera rotates slowly along the roll axis.
Requires toggling for damage infliction.
Timer starts with the game and fires its targets continuously.
Door spawns opened and works in reverse direction.
If set, the item will not drop to the ground. Bots will ignore it.
Entity bobs alongside the X axis.
Entity rotates alongside the X axis.
Entity bobs alongside the Y axis.
Entity rotates alongside the Y axis.
